alert.note: Alert for Ouachita (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 30 at 1:33PM CDT until March 30 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Ouachita Parish in north central Louisiana... * Until 215 PM CDT. * At 133 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles southwest of Richwood, or 10 miles south of Brownsville-Bawcom, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Monroe around 140 PM CDT. Richwood around 145 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Fondale, Fairbanks, Perryville, Bosco, Pine Grove, Guthrie and Millhaven. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
